en-us.learning_promise:
This unit introduces your students to engineering design skills. They’ll learn about the steps that are involved in defining a problem, brainstorming solutions, and testing and refining prototypes to improve their ideas. They'll learn observation skills by gathering information about a problem and modifying a solution to meet the needs of others.

Your students will help a story character by recounting experiences using relevant facts and descriptive details. This will help to develop their collaborative conversation skills.

lessons.lesson_description: Help Leo enter the amusement park with the Fast Lane!
lessons.lesson_sub_title: Help Leo enter the amusement park with the Fast Lane!

text.content: Leo sees a long line of people. They're waiting at the ticket booth. They need to buy their tickets.
Leo doesn't have to wait. He already has a ticket. He can use the Fast Lane.
Build the Fast Lane for Leo to use.
Here's your challenge: create the program that turns on the light when Leo shows his yellow ticket to the Color Sensor.
Create the program. It turns on the light when Leo shows his yellow ticket to the Color Sensor.

Upgrade the Fast Lane for Leo.

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App installed

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 1 The Fast Lane

lessons.lesson_description: Create a new spinning ride for Sofie to try!
lessons.lesson_sub_title: Create a new spinning ride for Sofie to try!

text.content: Sofie is having fun at the amusement park. She wants to try all the rides!
Sofie thinks it would be fun to try a spinning ride.
Build the carousel for Sofie to try.
Here's your challenge: create the program that makes the carousel spin.
Create the program. It makes the carousel spin.

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Classic Carousel

lessons.lesson_description: Maria doesn’t want a ride that goes too fast. Do you think the swing will be a perfect fit?
lessons.lesson_sub_title: Maria doesn’t want a ride that goes too fast. Do you think the swing will be a perfect fit?

text.content: Maria’s friends are riding a big roller coaster. It goes too fast for Maria.
Maria will try the swing. She's excited! It doesn't go too fast.
Build the swing for Maria to ride.
Here's your challenge: create the program that makes the swing move.
Create the program. It makes the swing move.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 3 The Perfect Swing

lessons.lesson_description: Oh, no! Daniel dropped his snack. Help him get a new one from the snack stand.
lessons.lesson_sub_title: Oh, no! Daniel dropped his snack. Help him get a new one from the snack stand.

text.content: Daniel is very sad. He dropped his snack.
Daniel is still hungry. He wants to get another snack from the snack stand.
Build the snack stand so that Daniel can get another snack.
Here's your challenge: create the program that serves another snack to Daniel.
Create the program. It serves another snack to Daniel when he shows his blue snack ticket.

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 4 Snack Stand

lessons.lesson_description: Round and round! Sofie and Leo are excited to try this new spinning ride today.
lessons.lesson_sub_title: Round and round! Sofie and Leo are excited to try this new spinning ride today.

text.content: Sofie and Leo have found a brand-new teacup ride.
Sofie and Leo will be the first ones to try the teacup ride. They wonder if the ride will go fast or slow.
Build the teacup ride for Sofie and Leo to try.
Here's your challenge: create the program that starts the teacup ride for Sofie and Leo.
Create the program. It starts the teacup ride.

text.content: Change your program to improve the teacup ride.
Upgrade the teacup ride to fit more friends. Make sure that all the seats can move or spin!

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App installed

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 5 Twirling Teacups

lessons.lesson_description: The team wants to ride the Ferris Wheel together. How can you help them?
lessons.lesson_sub_title: The team wants to ride the Ferris Wheel together. How can you help them?

text.content: The team will go on another ride together.
They find the Ferris Wheel. They wonder why it isn't stopping long enough to let them get on.
Build the Ferris Wheel for the team to ride.

building_instruction.title: Gecko U2L6 The Spinning Ferris Wheel

text.content: Here's your challenge: create the program that starts the Ferris Wheel.
Create the program. It starts the Ferris Wheel.

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App installed

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 6 The Spinning Ferris Wheel

lessons.lesson_description: It’s time to create your very own amusement park ride!
lessons.lesson_sub_title: It’s time to create your very own amusement park ride!

text.content: The team walks by a new area that's under construction at the amusement park.
They wonder what type of ride will go there.
Imagine a new ride for the amusement park.
Here's your challenge: Create a new ride for the amusement park. Use at least one motor or sensor.
Here's your challenge: Create a new ride for the amusement park. Use at least one motor or sensor.

teacher_support.things_you_will_need:
(one for every two students)

- LEGO® Education SPIKE™ Essential Set
- Device with the LEGO® Education SPIKE™ App installed
- OPTIONAL: Additional materials for brainstorming (e.g., notebook paper, science notebook, etc.)

lessons.title: SPIKE Essential Lesson 7 The Most Amazing Amusement Park

en-us.title: Gecko Amazing Amusement Park U2
en-us.unit_plan_description: Come enjoy the amusement park with Leo, Maria, Sofie, and Daniel. Design, create, and improve wild and crazy rides for the four minifigures to enjoy. What can you build?
